Question
========

Right after the vacations you hear that you have to take a true-false test with 30 questions must take. Suppose you have to pass 70% (or 21 questions) of all the questions and you haven't been able to prepare at all. What is the probability that you will give the correct answer on 70% or more of all the questions if you guess all the answers? (Students should use the table of Standard Normal Probabilities.)

Answerlist
----------

* 0,03
* 0,30
* 0,70
* 0,97

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.03: Correct
* 0.30: Incorrect
* 0.70: Incorrect
* 0.97: Incorrect
